Become a campaign volunteer and be a part of creating a more just West Virginia.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

In the past two weeks, we have visited eight towns, sharing our three new, long-term integrated campaigns with communities, organizations, policy-makers, activists, and others across the state.

We are so excited to be focusing our work in a way that we believe can fundamentally change West Virginia to make it a more just and peaceful home for all. We started this process a couple of years ago with strategic planning and a goal to prioritize a few key areas where we could make a significant difference. We took our time, studied the issues, did our research, and developed a plan.

Our focus on Criminal Justice Reform, Juvenile Justice Reform, and Defending Democracy stems from our desire to make change where it is sorely needed, where we can help provide leadership, and where, given the political realities of West Virginia, real, positive change is possible. Our goals are ambitious: A 50 percent reduction in people locked in cages, a 75 percent reduction in the number of juveniles in detention, and a landscape of civic engagement with fewer barriers and more participants, to name a few. But with a plan and a lot of hard work, these goals are achievable.

We developed these goals by making realistic estimates of how much things could change with policy reforms, and we looked at where we rank in the nation. Our goals are driven not only by the idea that we shouldnâ€™t be last or near-last in the nation, nor that we can make ourselves average. Our goals are driven by the belief that we should and can be national leaders; that we can set the example for how to improve these systems. As we move forward in this important campaign work, we will continue to work with communities throughout West Virginia to take on these major campaign goals.

This kind of radical reform is possible, but it will take all of us. Sign up today to become a campaign volunteer and help us make history!

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of West Virginia
